text: 1. Hydration supports temperature regulation by enabling the body to cool itself through sweating. 2. It helps maintain proper joint lubrication, reducing discomfort and stiffness. 3. Adequate water intake supports efficient nutrient transport and waste removal.

Inflation can occur when demand for goods and services increases faster than supply. It may also result from rising production costs that lead businesses to raise prices. Additionally, excessive growth in the money supply can reduce purchasing power over time.

Plants use sunlight to make their own food. They take in carbon dioxide from the air and water from the soil. With the energy from light, they turn these into sugars that help them grow and release oxygen.

Inflation happens when prices rise due to increased demand. It can also result from higher costs of production and supply chain disruptions. Central banks often respond by adjusting interest rates to stabilize the economy.

Photosynthesis is a biochemical process in which plants convert light energy into chemical energy through reactions involving chlorophyll and electron transport chains.
